sentences.sContent: Slowly my eyes became accustomed to the darkness.
sentences.sCn: 我的眼睛渐渐适应了黑暗。

sentences.sContent: Helen became increasingly anxious about her husband’s strange behaviour.
sentences.sCn: 海伦越来越担心她丈夫的反常行为。

sentences.sContent: Pollution from cars has become a major problem.
sentences.sCn: 汽车污染已成为严重的问题。

sentences.sContent: When did you first want to become a teacher?
sentences.sCn: 你最早是什么时候想要当一名教师的？

sentences.sContent: ...he has since become a professional painter...
...the Delta has become one of the leading economic regions and a major manufacturing center both of China and the world...
...and it had become successful very fast...
...Normal forgetting may even be a safety mechanism to ensure our brain doesn’t become too full...

...Loosely managed teams can become hotbeds of distraction―employees routinely complain that they can’t get their work done because they are forced to spend too much time in meetings or compelled to work in noisy offices...
...Barley was an unexpected find: the crop was domesticated in Western Eurasia and didn't become a preventing food in central China until about 2...
...Mountain Tai has become one of the most well-known tourist attractions in China...
...there are growing concerns that robots could become a threat...
...high blood pressure has become an increasing problem...
...They help them become aware of design and technique...

phrases.pCn: 使遭遇…；…降临于；发生…情况
习惯于；对…变得习以为常

trans.tranOther: to start to have a feeling or quality, or to start to develop into something
